title.narrative: Regional Electricity Access and BEST Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to increase access to grid electricity, enhance power system stability, and increase renewable energy integration in the West Africa Power Pool.

participating-org.narrative: ECOWAS Directorate for Energy and Mines

condition.narrative: FA with Cote d’Ivoire: Schedule 2, Section D: The Recipient shall ensure, and cause CI-ENERGIES to ensure, that a training plan,acceptable to the Association, aimed for target groups associated with Parts 2.1 of the Project is developed that not later thansix (6) months after the Effective Date, and thereafter implemented with a view to raise awareness of the risks and mitigate theimpacts of the activities related to the supply and installation of 105 MWh battery energy storage systems and synchronizationequipment under Part 2.1 of the Project.

FA with Cote d’Ivoire: Schedule 2, Section I.A, 2: The Recipient, through its Ministry of Mines, Petroleum and Energy, shall, notlater than three (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Projectimplementation, a representative and alternate to the Project Technical Committee.

FA with Cote d’Ivoire: Schedule 2, Section I.A,1: The Recipient, through its ministry responsible for economy and finance, shall,not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Projectimplementation, a representative and alternate to the Steering Committee. The composition of the Steering Committee shall alsocomprise the head of the national utilities of the Participating Countries or his/her permanent representative and one high-levelrepresentative of the ministry responsible for energy of each Participating Country.

FA with Cote d’Ivoire: Schedule 2, Section I.C, 5: The Recipient shall establish, and cause CI-ENERGIES to establish, not laterthan one (1) month after the Effective Date, and thereafter shall maintain, operate, and publicize the availability of, and shallcause CI-ENERGIES to maintain, maintain, operate, maintain and publicize the availability of, throughout Project implementation, anaccessible and functional grievance redress mechanism for Parts 2.1, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, with adequate staffing andprocesses, and in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, to receive, register, hear, facilitate and determine fairly,safely, ethically and in good faith and on a confidential basis, all complaints, concerns and grievances raised in relation toParts 2.1, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, including those related to the environmental and social matters and a dedicated channel forthe ethical handling of SEAH complaints, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by such mechanism ina manner satisfactory to the Association.

FA with ECOWAS: Schedule 2, Section I.A, 1: a GBV consultant to be employed not later than three (3) months after the EffectiveDate with qualifications and experience and under terms of reference satisfactory by the Association.

FA with ECOWAS: Schedule 2, Section I.B, 5: The Recipient shall establish, not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date,and thereafter maintain, operate, maintain and publicize the availability of, throughout Project implementation, an accessible andfunctional grievance mechanism for Part 4.1 of the Project, with adequate staffing and processes, and in form and substancesatisfactory to the Association, to receive, register, hear, facilitate and determine fairly, safely, ethically and in good faithand on a confidential basis, all complaints, concerns and grievances raised in relation to Part 4.1 of the Project, including thoserelated to the environmental and social matters and a dedicated channel for the ethical handling of SEAH complaints, and take allmeasures necessary to implement the determinations made by such mechanism in a manner satisfactory to the Association.

FA with ECOWAS: Schedule 2, Section I.F, (a): The Recipient shall not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, trainthe PIU accountant on the financial management and disbursement aspects of the Project.

FA with ECOWAS: Schedule 2, Section I.F, (b): The Recipient shall not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, recruitan independent external auditor, with qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association and under terms of referenceapproved by the Association.

FA with Mali: Schedule 2, Section I.A, 1: The Recipient, through its ministry in charge of finance, shall, not later than three (3)months after the Effective Date, appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representativeand alternate to the Steering Committee. The composition of the Steering Committee shall comprise also the head of the nationalutilities of the Participating Countries or his/her permanent representative and one high-level representative of the ministry incharge of energy of each Participating Country.

FA with Mali: Schedule 2, Section I.A, 2: The Recipient, through its ministry in charge of energy, shall, not later than three (3)months after the Effective Date, appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representativeand alternate to the Project Technical Committee.

FA with Mali: Schedule 2, Section I.C, 5: The Recipient shall establish, and cause EDM-SA to establish, not later than one (1)month after the Effective Date, and thereafter shall maintain, operate, and publicize the availability of, and shall cause EDM-SAto maintain, maintain, operate, maintain and publicize the availability of, throughout Project implementation, an accessible andfunctional grievance redress mechanism for Parts 2.2, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, with adequate staffing and processes, and in formand substance satisfactory to the Association, to receive, register, hear, facilitate and determine fairly, safely, ethically andin good faith and on a confidential basis, all complaints, concerns and grievances raised in relation to Parts 2.2, 3 and 4.2 ofthe Project, including those related to the environmental and social matters and a dedicated channel for the ethical handling ofSEAH complaints, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by such mechanism in a manner satisfactory tothe Association.

FA with Mali: Schedule 2, Section I.D: The Recipient shall ensure, and cause EDM to ensure, that a training plan, acceptable to theAssociation, aimed for target groups associated with Parts 2.2 of the Project is developed that not later than six (6) months afterthe Effective Date, and thereafter implemented with a view to raise awareness of the risks and mitigate the impacts of theactivities related to the supply and installation of 80 MWh battery energy storage systems and synchronization equipment under Part2.2 of the Project.

FA with Mauritania: Schedule 2, Section I.A, 1: The Recipient, through its ministry responsible for economy, shall, not later thanthree (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, arepresentative and alternate to the Steering Committee. The composition of the Steering Committee shall comprise also the head ofthe national utilities of the Participating Countries or his/her permanent representative and one high-level representative of theministry responsible for energy of each Participating Country.

FA with Mauritania: Schedule 2, Section I.A, 2: The Recipient, through its Ministry of Oil, Mines and Energy, shall, not later thanthree (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, arepresentative and alternate to the Project Technical Committee.

FA with Mauritania: Schedule 2, Section I.C, 6: The Recipient shall establish, and cause SOMELEC to establish, not later than one(1) month after the Effective Date, and thereafter shall maintain, operate, and publicize the availability of, and shall causeSOMELEC to maintain, maintain, operate, maintain and publicize the availability of, throughout Project implementation, anaccessible and functional grievance redress mechanism for Parts 1.1, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, with adequate staffing andprocesses, and in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, to receive, register, hear, facilitate and determine fairly,safely, ethically and in good faith and on a confidential basis, all complaints, concerns and grievances raised in relation toParts 1.1, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, including those related to the environmental and social matters and a dedicated channel forthe ethical handling of SEAH complaints, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by such mechanism ina manner satisfactory to the Association.

FA with Niger: Schedule 2, Section I.A, 1: The Recipient, through its ministry responsible for planning, shall, not later thanthree (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, arepresentative and alternate to the Steering Committee. The composition of the Steering Committee shall also comprise the head ofthe national utilities of the Participating Countries or his/her permanent representative and one high-level representative of theministry responsible for energy of each Participating Country.

FA with Niger: Schedule 2, Section I.A, 2: The Recipient, through its Ministry of Energy and Oil, shall, not later than three (3)months after the Effective Date, appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representativeand alternate to the Project Technical Committee.

FA with Niger: Schedule 2, Section I.C, 5: The Recipient shall establish, and cause NIGELEC to establish, not later than one (1)month after the Effective Date, and thereafter shall maintain, operate, and publicize the availability of, and shall cause NIGELECto maintain, maintain, operate, maintain and publicize the availability of, throughout Project implementation, an accessible andfunctional grievance redress mechanism for Parts 1.2, 2.3, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, with adequate staffing and processes, and inform and substance satisfactory to the Association, to receive, register, hear, facilitate and determine fairly, safely, ethicallyand in good faith and on a confidential basis, all complaints, concerns and grievances raised in relation to Parts 1.2, 2.3, 3 and4.2 of the Project, including those related to the environmental and social matters and a dedicated channel for the ethic handlingof SEAH complaints, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by such mechanism in a manner satisfactoryto the Association.

FA with Niger: Schedule 2, Section I.D: The Recipient shall ensure, and cause NIGELEC to ensure, that a training plan, acceptableto the Association, aimed for target groups associated with Part 2.3 of the Project is developed that not later than six (6) monthsafter the Effective Date, and thereafter implemented with a view to raise awareness of the risks and mitigate the impacts of theactivities related to the supply and installation of 20 MWh battery energy storage technology and synchronization equipment underPart 2.3 of the Project.

FA with Senegal: Schedule 2, Section I.A, 1: The Recipient, through its ministry responsible for finance, shall, not later thanthree (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, arepresentative and alternate to the Steering Committee. The composition of the Steering Committee shall comprise also the head ofthe national utilities of the Participating Countries or his/her permanent representative and one high-level representative of theministry of energy of each Participating Country.

FA with Senegal: Schedule 2, Section I.A, 2: The Recipient, through its Ministry of Oil and Energy, shall, not later than three (3)months after the Effective Date, appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representativeand alternate to the Project Technical Committee.

FA with Senegal: Schedule 2, Section I.C, 6: The Recipient shall establish, and cause SENELEC to establish, not later than one (1)month after the Effective Date, and thereafter shall maintain, operate, and publicize the availability of, and shall cause SENELECto maintain, maintain, operate, maintain and publicize the availability of, throughout Project implementation, an accessible andfunctional grievance redress mechanism for Parts 1.3, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, with adequate staffing and processes, and in formand substance satisfactory to the Association, to receive, register, hear, facilitate and determine fairly, safely, ethically andin good faith and on a confidential basis, all complaints, concerns and grievances raised in relation to Parts 1.3, 3 and 4.2 ofthe Project, including those related to the environmental and social matters and a dedication channel for the ethical handling ofSEAH complaints, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by such mechanism in a manner satisfactory tothe Association.

PA with CI-ENERGIES: Schedule, Section I.A, 1: CI-ENERGIES shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date,appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representative and alternate to the SteeringCommittee.

PA with CI-ENERGIES: Schedule, Section I.A, 2: CI-ENERGIES, shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date,appoint, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representative and alternate to the ProjectTechnical Committee.

PA with CI-ENERGIES: Schedule, Section I.A, 3: and the following staff to be employed not later than three (3) months after theEffective Date: (A) an additional environmental specialist; (B) one additional social consultant; and (C) one SEA/SH consultant,

PA with CI-ENERGIES: Schedule, Section I.B, 5: CI-ENERGIES shall establish, not later than one (1) month after the EffectiveDate, and thereafter maintain, operate, maintain and publicize the availability of, throughout Project implementation, anaccessible and functional grievance redress mechanism for Parts 2.1, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, with adequate staffing andprocesses, and in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, to receive, register, hear, facilitate and determine fairly,safely, ethically and in good faith and on a confidential basis, all complaints, concerns and grievances raised in relation toParts 2.1, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, including those related to the environmental and social matters and a dedicated channel forthe ethical handling of complaints of SEAH allegations, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made bysuch mechanism in a manner satisfactory to the Association.

PA with CI-ENERGIES: Schedule, Section I.C (a): CI-ENERGIES shall not later than five (5) months after the Effectiveness Date,update the Project Implementation Manual, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, to adapt it to the Project;

PA with CI-ENERGIES: Schedule, Section I.E, 2: CI-ENERGIES shall, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, develop,and thereafter implement, a training plan, acceptable to the Association, aimed at target groups associated with Parts 2.1 of theProject with a view to raise awareness of the risks and mitigate the impacts of the activities related to the supply andinstallation of 105 MWh battery energy storage technology and synchronization equipment under Part 2.1 of the Project.

PA with CI-ENERGIES: Schedule, Section I.F (a): CI-ENERGIES shall not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date: (i)modify the work plan of CI-ENERGIES’ internal auditors annual work to include the activities to be carried out under the Project;and (ii) configure its existing accounting software for the Project to generate Project financial reports and train its staff inthe use thereof;

PA with CI-ENERGIES: Schedule, Section I.F (b): CI-ENERGIES shall not later than five (5) months after the Effective Date, updatethe financial management manual for the Project in form and substance satisfactory to the Association;

PA with CI-ENERGIES: Schedule, Section I.F (c): CI-ENERGIES shall not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, appointan independent external auditor for the Project with qualifications and experience and under terms of reference and satisfactory tothe Association.

PA with EDM-SA: Schedule, Section I.A, 1: EDM-SA shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, andthereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representative and alternate to the Steering Committee.

PA with EDM-SA: Schedule, Section I.A, 2: EDM-SA, shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, andthereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representative and alternate to the Project TechnicalCommittee.

PA with EDM-SA: Schedule, Section I.A, 3 (iii): be supplemented with the employment, not later than three (3) months after theEffective Date under terms of reference and with qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association, of oneenvironmental consultant, one social consultant and one SEAH consultant.

PA with EDM-SA: Schedule, Section I.B, 5: EDM-SA shall establish, not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, andthereafter maintain, operate, maintain and publicize the availability of, throughout Project implementation, an accessible andfunctional grievance redress mechanism for Parts 2.2, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, with adequate staffing and processes, and in formand substance satisfactory to the Association, to receive, register, hear, facilitate and determine fairly, safely, ethically andin good faith and on a confidential basis, all complaints, concerns and grievances raised in relation to Parts 2.2, 3 and 4.2 ofthe Project, including those related to the environmental and social matters and a dedicated channel for the ethical handling ofSEAH complaints, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by such mechanism in a manner satisfactory tothe Association.

PA with EDM-SA: Schedule, Section I.C, (i): EDM-SA shall not later than five (5) months after the Effectiveness Date, update theProject Implementation Manual, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, to adapt it to the Project;

PA with EDM-SA: Schedule, Section I.E, 2: EDM-SA shall, that not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, develop, andthereafter implement, a training plan, acceptable to the Association, aimed at target groups associated with Part 2.2 of theProject with a view to raise awareness of the risks and mitigate the impacts of the activities related to the supply andinstallation of 80 MWh battery energy storage systems and synchronization equipment under Part 2.2 of the Project.

PA with EDM-SA: Schedule, Section I.F, (a): EDM-SA shall not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date: (i) update itsinternal audit plan in form and substance satisfactory to the Association; (ii) train the PIU senior accountant on the financialmanagement and disbursement aspects of the Project; and (iii) install a customize accounting software for the Project to generateProject financial reports and train its staff in the use thereof;

PA with EDM-SA: Schedule, Section I.F, (b): EDM-SA shall not later than five (5) months after the Effective Date, update thefinancial management manual for the Project in form and substance satisfactory to the Association;

PA with EDM-SA: Schedule, Section I.F, (c): EDM-SA shall not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, appoint anindependent external auditor for the Project with qualifications and experience and under terms of reference and satisfactory tothe Association.

PA with NIGELEC: Schedule, Section I.A, 1: NIGELEC shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, andthereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representative and alternate to the Steering Committee.

PA with NIGELEC: Schedule, Section I.A, 2 (iii): be supplemented with the employment, not later than three (3) months after theEffective Date and under terms of reference and with qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association: (A) oneadditional environmental consultant; (B) one additional social consultant: (C) one SEAH consultant; and (D) one security riskconsultant.

PA with NIGELEC: Schedule, Section I.A, 3: NIGELEC, shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, andthereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representative and alternate to the Project TechnicalCommittee.

PA with NIGELEC: Schedule, Section I.B, 5: NIGELEC shall establish, not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, andthereafter maintain, operate, maintain and publicize the availability of, throughout Project implementation, an accessible andfunctional grievance redress mechanism for Parts 1.2, 2.3, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, with adequate staffing and processes, and inform and substance satisfactory to the Association, to receive, register, hear, facilitate and determine fairly, safely, ethicallyand in good faith and on a confidential basis, all complaints, concerns and grievances raised in relation to Parts 1.2, 2.3, 3 and4.2 of the Project, including those related to the environmental and social matters and a dedicated channel for the ethicalhandling of SEAH complaints, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by such mechanism in a mannersatisfactory to the Association.

PA with NIGELEC: Schedule, Section I.C: NIGELEC shall not later than five (5) months after the Effectiveness Date, update theProject Implementation Manual, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, to adapt it to the Project;

PA with NIGELEC: Schedule, Section I.E, 2: NIGELEC shall, that not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, develop,and thereafter implement, a training plan, acceptable to the Association, aimed at target groups associated with Part 2.3 of theProject with a view to raise awareness of the risks and mitigate the impacts of the activities related to the supply andinstallation of 20 MWh battery energy storage technology and synchronization equipment under Part 2.3 of the Project.

PA with NIGELEC: Schedule, Section I.F, 1 (a): NIGELEC shall not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date: (i) recruitan accountant with qualifications and experience and under terms of reference satisfactory to the Association and train him/her onthe financial management and disbursement aspects of the Project; and (ii) appoint an internal auditor for the Project withqualifications and experience and under terms of reference and satisfactory to the Association;

PA with NIGELEC: Schedule, Section I.F, 1 (b): NIGELEC shall not later than five (5) months after the Effective Date: (i)customize the existing accounting software to fit the Project and allow it to generate Project financial reports and train itsstaff in the use thereof; and (ii) update the financial management manual for the Project in form and substance satisfactory to theAssociation;

PA with NIGELEC: Schedule, Section I.F, 1 (c): NIGELEC shall not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, appoint anindependent external auditor for the Project with qualifications and experience and under terms of reference and satisfactory tothe Association

PA with SENELEC: Schedule, Section I.A, 1: SENELEC shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, andthereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representative and alternate to the Steering Committee.

PA with SENELEC: Schedule, Section I.A, 2: SENELEC, shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, andthereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representative and alternate to the Project TechnicalCommittee.

PA with SENELEC: Schedule, Section I.A, 3 (iii): supplemented with the employment, not later than three (3) months after theEffective Date and under terms of reference and with qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association, of :(A) onesocial consultant; (B) one occupational health and safety consultant; and (iii) one SEAH consultant.

PA with SENELEC: Schedule, Section I.C: SENELEC shall: (i) not later than five (5) months after the Effectiveness Date, update theProject Implementation Manual, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, to adapt it to the Project;

PA with SENELEC: Schedule, Section I.F (C): SENELEC shall not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, appoint anindependent external auditor for the Project with qualifications and experience and under terms of reference and satisfactory tothe Association.

PA with SENELEC: Schedule, Section I.F (a): SENELEC shall not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, recruit anaccountant with qualifications and experience and under terms of reference satisfactory to the Association and train him/her on thefinancial management and disbursement aspects under the Project;

PA with SENELEC: Schedule, Section I.F (b): SENELEC shall not later than five (5) months after the Effective Date, update thefinancial management manual for the Project in form and substance satisfactory to the Association;

PA with SOMELEC: Schedule, Section I.A, 1: SOMELEC shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, andthereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representative and its alternate to the Steering Committee.

PA with SOMELEC: Schedule, Section I.A, 2: SOMELEC, shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint, andthereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a representative and its alternate to the Project TechnicalCommittee.

PA with SOMELEC: Schedule, Section I.A, 3 (iii): supplemented with the employment, not later than three (3) months after theEffective Date and under terms of reference and with qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association, of one SEAHspecialist, one environmental specialist, and one social specialist.

PA with SOMELEC: Schedule, Section I.B, 5: SOMELEC shall establish, not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, andthereafter maintain, operate, maintain and publicize the availability of, throughout Project implementation, an accessible andfunctional grievance redress mechanism for Parts 1.1, 3 and 4.2 of the Project, with adequate staffing and processes, and in formand substance satisfactory to the Association, to receive, register, hear, facilitate and determine fairly, safely, ethically andin good faith and on a confidential basis, all complaints, concerns and grievances raised in relation to Parts 1.1, 3 and 4.2 ofthe Project, including those related to the environmental and social matters and a dedicated channel for the ethical handling ofSEAH complaints, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by such mechanism in a manner satisfactory tothe Association.

PA with SOMELEC: Schedule, Section I.C (i): SOMELEC shall not later than five (5) months after the Effectiveness Date, update theProject Implementation Manual, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, to adapt it to the Project;

PA with SOMELEC: Schedule, Section I.F, (a): SOMELEC shall not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, recruit afinancial management specialist and an accountant, both with qualifications and experience and under terms of referencesatisfactory to the Association, and train them on the financial management and disbursement aspects of the the Project;

PA with SOMELEC: Schedule, Section I.F, (b): SOMELEC shall not later than five (5) months after the Effective Date, update thefinancial management manual for the Project in form and substance satisfactory to the Association;

PA with SOMELEC: Schedule, Section I.F, (c): SOMELEC shall not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, recruit anindependent external auditor for the Project with qualifications and experience and under terms of reference and satisfactory tothe Association.

title.narrative: Enabled additional capacity of renewable energy
Additional firm capacity for frequency control provided
Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) installed in Cote d'Ivoire
People provided with new or improved electricity service
Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) installed in Niger
Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) installed in Mali
Qualified team to operate the electricity market provided to ERERA
Provided qualified team for ERERA to operate the electricity market, of which female recruits
People provided with new or improved electricity service - Female
